channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: The only Perl job with a swimming pool; very exciting financial services company in London, The EU
item.description: he best thing â€” in my opinion, anyway â€” about working for a development team led by an active member of the London Perl community, is that you know management love Perl, support using the best available Perl tooling, and will create a technical environment where Perl developers will be happy.

item.title: London-based Perl developer? Free Â£10,000 payrise (individual results may vary)
item.description: Over the New Year, the majority of Perl employers in London decided they were voraciously hiring. At the same time, apparently, most Perl developers decided to scuttle â€” hermit-crab-like â€” away from the active job market.

item.title: Fancy a few days a week in beautiful Irvine, CA? Mountain and harbour views from the office
item.description: We are looking for a fulltime Perl developer who can join us onsite at our beautiful offices a few days a week in Irvine, and work from home the rest of the time (or fulltime in Irvine).

item.title: What is the difference between require and use in Perl? What does import do?
item.description: (video)

item.title: Final Grant Report : RPerl User Documentation #2
item.description: Mark shares the final grant report from Will Braswell, on his RPerl documentation.

item.title: Tony Cook's Grant Report for December 2016
item.description: The latest report on Perl 5 work done by Tony Cook.

item.title: Dave Mitchell's Grant Extended
item.description: Dave Mitchell's grant has been extended, so he can continue doing his sterling work on Perl 5.

item.title: Grants Committee needs a new member
item.description: The Perl Foundation's grants committee is looking for fresh blood.

item.title: Perl Adventure Series Part 2
item.description: JT's report from the second meeting of the group working on a game together.

item.title: Reviving Ottawa.pm
item.description: Yanick, guerilla knitter and orchid smuggler, is reviving Ottawa.pm, and they're having their first meeting on February 15th.

item.title: Perl 6 By Example: Parsing INI files
item.description: Mortitz walks us through creating a parser for .ini files in Perl 6. This is from his Perl 6 book, which is a work in progress.

item.title: 2017.04 Welcome!
item.description: The latest from the Perl 6 world, leading with the addition of two members to the Rakudo core development team: Nick Logan and Christian BartolomÃ¤us.

item.title: Send in a Perl aref to C, get back a Perl array
item.description: Steve shows you "how to pass a Perl array reference (aref) into a C function, convert the aref into a C array, work on it, then push it back onto the stack so the C function returns it as a Perl array".

item.title: /xx means more meaningless whitespace (and thatâ€™s good)
item.description: Brian explains the /xx regex flag, which is being added in 5.26.

item.title: Strawberry Perl 5.24.1.1 + 5.22.3.1 released
item.description: Get yer strawberries here, lovely fresh strawberries!

item.title: Are Restricted/Locked Hashes A Failed Experiment?
item.description: There's been some discussion on P5P related to locked hashes, and whether they're worth the cost? A hash can be locked to a specific set of keys with the lock_keys function in Hash::Util. Do you use this for production code? If so, please let them know.

item.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: January 16th-22nd
item.description: The removal of '.' from @INC continues to be discussed, amongst other topics.

item.title: Bit string manipulation made easy with Bit::Manip
item.description: Steve introduces his new module Bit::Manip, which provides functions for manipulating bit strings.

item.title: Dancer2 0.204003
item.description: There's a new release of Dancer 2, which fixes an issue with unlisted dependencies, and also improves error handling.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: #288 - Grants committee looking for new members
item.description:
The Perl Foundation grants committee needs you!

Neil
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
